posts.raw_content:
... so I told him.  When I gave in my opinion an unbiased version of what Charlie generally stood for and said to people, my son said "so he was like Martin Luther King."  That can be a deep subject, but for this purpose, I just said "yeah"... cause my son elaborated and said "he was killed just for what he was saying."  I said "yeah."

I told him about the flags being a half staff today, and how some people might not know it is for Charlie Kirk.  He said he was going to take a picture of the flag on his way into school.   He did, and he sent it to me.  Today after school he just seemed "heavy."  Like the day had been heavy and sad at school or something.  He fell asleep before 7.

There isn't necessarily a point to this... it's just really something to be talking with my child about something like this.
posts.author: HeavenlyTrumpets
posts.title: I talked to my 6th grader yesterday after school about what happened with Charlie Kirk. Interestingly, he said his social studies teacher had mentioned him just two days prior. He said all that was said was that he was a conservative who did debates at colleges. He asked what I thought about him...
posts.content:
... so I told him. When I gave in my opinion an unbiased version of what Charlie generally stood for and said to people, my son said "so he was like Martin Luther King." That can be a deep subject, but for this purpose, I just said "yeah"... cause my son elaborated and said "he was killed just for what he was saying." I said "yeah."

I told him about the flags being a half staff today, and how some people might not know it is for Charlie Kirk. He said he was going to take a picture of the flag on his way into school. He did, and he sent it to me. Today after school he just seemed "heavy." Like the day had been heavy and sad at school or something. He fell asleep before 7.

There isn't necessarily a point to this... it's just really something to be talking with my child about something like this.
